verses.verse: And it came to pass in those days <WH3117>, when there was no king <WH4428> in Israel <WH3478>, that there was a certain <WH376> Levite <WH3881> sojourning <WH1481> on the side <WH3411> of mountain <WH2022> Ephraim <WH669>, who took <WH3947> to him a concubine <WH802> out of Beth <WH1035>–lehem–judah.

And his concubine <WH6370> played the whore <WH2181> against him <WH3212>, and went away from him unto her father <WH1>'s house <WH1004> to Beth <WH1035>–lehem–judah, and was there four <WH702> whole months <WH2320>.

And her husband <WH376> arose <WH6965>, and went <WH3212> after <WH310> her <WH1696>, to speak friendly <WH3820> unto her <WH7725>, and to bring her again, having his servant <WH5288> with him <WH6776>, and a couple of donkeys <WH2543>: and she brought <WH935> him into her father <WH1>'s house <WH1004>: and when the father <WH1> of the girl <WH5291> saw <WH7200> him <WH8055>, he rejoiced to meet him <WH7125>.

And his father in law <WH2859>, the damsel <WH5291>'s father <WH1>, retained <WH2388> him <WH3427>; and he lived with him three <WH7969> days <WH3117>: so they did eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354>, and lodged there <WH3885>.

And it came to pass on the fourth <WH7243> day <WH3117>, when they arose early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, that he rose up <WH6965> to depart <WH3212>: and the damsel <WH5291>'s father <WH1> said <WH559> unto his son in law <WH2860>, Comfort <WH5582> your heart <WH3820> with a morsel <WH6595> of bread <WH3899>, and afterward <WH310> go your way <WH3212>.

And they sat down <WH3427>, and did eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354> both <WH8147> of them together <WH3162>: for the damsel <WH5291>'s father <WH1> had said <WH559> unto the man <WH376>, Be content <WH2974>, I pray you <WH3885>, and stay all night, and let your heart <WH3820> be merry <WH3190>.
And when the man <WH376> rose up <WH6965> to depart <WH3212>, his father in law <WH2859> urged <WH6484> him <WH3885>: therefore he lodged there again <WH7725>.

And he arose early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242> on the fifth <WH2549> day <WH3117> to depart <WH3212>: and the damsel <WH5291>'s father <WH1> said <WH559>, Comfort <WH5582> your heart <WH3824>, I pray you <WH4102>. And they stayed until afternoon <WH3117>, and they did eat <WH398> both of them <WH8147>.

And when the man <WH376> rose up <WH6965> to depart <WH3212>, he <WH6370>, and his concubine, and his servant <WH5288>, his father in law <WH2859>, the damsel <WH5291>'s father <WH1>, said <WH559> unto him <WH3117>, Behold, now the day draws <WH7503> toward evening <WH6150>, I pray you stay all night <WH3885>: behold <WH3117>, the day grows to an end <WH2583>, lodge <WH3885> here <WH3824>, that your heart may be merry <WH3190>; and to morrow <WH4279> get you early <WH7925> on your way <WH1870>, that you may go <WH1980> home <WH168>.

But the man <WH376> would <WH14> not stay that night <WH3885>, but he rose up <WH6965> and departed <WH3212>, and came <WH935> over against <WH5227> Jebus <WH2982>, which is Jerusalem <WH3389>; and there were with him two <WH6776> donkeys <WH2543> saddled <WH2280>, his concubine also was with him <WH6370>.

And when they were by Jebus <WH2982>, the day <WH3117> was far <WH3966> spent <WH7286>; and the servant <WH5288> said <WH559> unto his master <WH113>, Come <WH3212>, I pray you <WH5493>, and let us turn in into this city <WH5892> of the Jebusites <WH2983>, and lodge in it <WH3885>.

And his master <WH113> said <WH559> unto him <WH5493>, We will not turn aside here into the city <WH5892> of a stranger <WH5237>, that is not of the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478>; we will pass over <WH5674> to Gibeah <WH1390>.

And he said <WH559> unto his servant <WH5288>, Come <WH3212>, and let us draw near <WH7126> to one <WH259> of these places <WH4725> to lodge all night <WH3885>, in Gibeah <WH1390>, or in Ramah <WH7414>.
And they passed on <WH5674> and went their way <WH3212>; and the sun <WH8121> went down <WH935> upon them when they were by <WH681> Gibeah <WH1390>, which belongs to Benjamin <WH1144>.

And they turned aside <WH5493> there <WH935>, to go in and to lodge <WH3885> in Gibeah <WH1390>: and when he went in <WH935>, he sat him down <WH3427> in a street <WH7339> of the city <WH5892>: for there was no man <WH376> that took <WH622> them into his house <WH1004> to lodging <WH3885>.

And <WH935>, behold, there came an old <WH2205> man <WH376> from his work <WH4639> out of the field <WH7704> at even <WH6153>, which was also <WH376> of mountain <WH2022> Ephraim <WH669>; and he stayed <WH1481> in Gibeah <WH1390>: but the men <WH582> of the place <WH4725> were Benjamites <WH1145>.

And when he had lifted up <WH5375> his eyes <WH5869>, he saw <WH7200> a wayfaring <WH732> man <WH376> in the street <WH7339> of the city <WH5892>: and the old <WH2205> man <WH376> said <WH559>, Where go <WH3212> you and from where <WH370> come you <WH935>

And he said <WH559> unto him <WH5674>, We are passing from Beth <WH1035>–lehem–judah toward the side <WH3411> of mountain <WH2022> Ephraim <WH669>; from there am I <WH3212>: and I went to Beth <WH1035>–lehem–judah, but I am now going <WH1980> to the house <WH1004> of the Lord <WH3068>; and there is no man <WH376> that receives <WH622> me to house <WH1004>.

Yet there is <WH3426> both straw <WH8401> and food <WH4554> for our donkeys <WH2543>; and there is bread <WH3899> and wine <WH3196> also for me <WH519>, and for your handmaid, and for the young man <WH5288> which is with your servants <WH5650>: there is no want <WH4270> of any thing <WH1697>.
And the old <WH2205> man <WH376> said <WH559>, Peace <WH7965> be with you <WH7535>; howsoever let all your wants <WH4270> lie upon me <WH3885>; only lodge not in the street <WH7339>.
So he brought <WH935> him into his house <WH1004>, and gave food <WH1101> unto the donkeys <WH2543>: and they washed <WH7364> their feet <WH7272>, and did eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354>.

Now as they were making their hearts <WH3820> merry <WH3190>, behold <WH582>, the men of the city <WH5892>, certain <WH582> sons <WH1121> of Belial <WH1100>, beset <WH5437> the house <WH1004> round about <WH5437>, and beat <WH1849> at the door <WH1817>, and spoke <WH559> to the master <WH1167> of the house <WH1004>, the old <WH2205> man <WH376>, saying <WH559>, Bring forth <WH3318> the man <WH376> that came <WH935> into your house <WH1004>, that we may know him <WH3045>.

And the man <WH376>, the master <WH1167> of the house <WH1004>, went out <WH3318> unto them <WH559>, and said unto them <WH408>, No, my brothers <WH251>, No <WH7489>, I pray you, do not so wickedly; seeing <WH310> that this man <WH376> is come <WH935> into my house <WH1004>, do <WH6213> not this wickedness <WH5039>.

Behold <WH1323>, here is my daughter a maiden <WH1330>, and his concubine <WH6370>; them I will bring out <WH3318> now <WH6031>, and humble you them <WH6213>, and do with them what seems <WH5869> good <WH2896> unto you <WH376>: but unto this man do <WH6213> not so <WH2063> vile <WH5039> a thing <WH1697>.

But the men <WH582> would <WH14> not listen <WH8085> to him <WH376>: so the man took <WH2388> his concubine <WH6370>, and brought <WH3318> her forth <WH2351> unto them <WH3045>; and they knew her <WH5953>, and abused her all the night <WH3915> until the morning <WH1242>: and when the day <WH7837> began to spring <WH5927>, they let her go <WH7971>.

Then came <WH935> the woman <WH802> in the dawning <WH6437> of the day <WH1242>, and fell down <WH5307> at the door <WH6607> of the man <WH376>'s house <WH1004> where her lord <WH113> was <WH216>, until it was light.

And her lord <WH113> rose up <WH6965> in the morning <WH1242>, and opened <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of the house <WH1004>, and went out <WH3318> to go <WH3212> his way <WH1870>: and <WH802>, behold, the woman his concubine <WH6370> was fallen down <WH5307> at the door <WH6607> of the house <WH1004>, and her hands <WH3027> were upon the threshold <WH5592>.

And he said <WH559> unto her <WH6965>, Up, and let us be going <WH3212>. But none answered <WH6030>. Then the man <WH376> took <WH3947> her up upon an donkey <WH2543>, and the man <WH376> rose up <WH6965>, and went <WH3212> him unto his place <WH4725>.

And when he was come <WH935> into his house <WH1004>, he took <WH3947> a knife <WH3979>, and laid hold <WH2388> on his concubine <WH6370>, and divided <WH5408> her <WH6106>, together with her bones, into twelve <WH8147> pieces <WH5409>, and sent <WH7971> her into all the coasts <WH1366> of Israel <WH3478>.

And it was so <WH1961>, that all that saw <WH7200> it said <WH559>, There was no such deed <WH2063> done nor seen <WH7200> from the day <WH3117> that the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> unto this day <WH3117>: consider <WH7760> of it <WH5779>, take advice, and speak your minds <WH1696>.
